item.title: Badstore - VulnHub Solution
item.description: New year, new challenge I decided to try VulnHub, it is different from the classic CTF i use to. Where to start? Easy at the beginning, I navigated to the timeline page, scrolled all the way down, found the first released machine, Badstore: 1.2.3, downloaded it, installed it, and let’s get started. Open the other VM with Kali and launch a scan with Nmap (classic), below the command: sudo nmap -sC -sV -oA badstore/nmap_result 192.

item.title: About me
item.description: Hi everyone 👋 I am Paolo, Cybercsecurity Enthusiast 😄 Pronouns: He/Him 📍 Milan, Italy 🔭 I’m currently working as Defensive cybersecurity specialist for Horizon Consulting. Help client to defense their perimeter to attacker. 🌱 I’m currently learning Web security and Malware Analysis Leanguages 🇮🇹 🇺🇸: Italian (Native speaker), English (Fluent) 📫 How to reach me: paolo.filippini99@gmail.com Interests 🌍 Web Security: I am trying to improve my skills in this area, reading articles and books, watching videos and opening Burp at least once a day 😄
